availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mordica Mullins (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and blacksmith.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Mullins. Father of Elizabeth Mullins, Martha Mullins, Henry Mullins, John Mullins, Marshall Mullins, Calloway Mullins, Margaret Mullins, Susan Mullins, Elisha Mullins, and Julia Ann Mullins. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Rockcastle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District, p. 205B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 564.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District 4, p. 67B.
